result_1:
[PYTHON]
def choose_num(x, y):
    if x > y:
        return -1
    
    for i in range(x, y + 1):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            return i
    
    return -1
[/PYTHON]
[TESTS]
# Test case 1:
assert choose_num(12, 15) == 14
# Test case 2:
assert choose_num(13, 12) == -1
# Test case 3:
assert choose_num(1, 1) == 1
# Test case 4:
assert choose_num(1, 3) == 2
# Test case 5:
assert choose_num(1, 5) == 3
[/TESTS]

result_4:
[PYTHON]
def choose_num(x, y):
    if x > y:
        return -1
    
    for i in range(x, y+1, 2):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            return i
    
    return -1
[/PYTHON]
[TESTS]
# Test case 1:
assert choose_num(12, 15) == 14
# Test case 2:
assert choose_num(13, 12) == -1
# Test case 3:
assert choose_num(10, 100) == 100
# Test case 4:
assert choose_num(1, 10) == 10
# Test case 5:
assert choose_num(11, 20) == 16
[/TESTS]

result_9:
[PYTHON]
def choose_num(x, y):
    if x > y:
        return -1
    for i in range(x, y+1, 2):
        if i == y:
            return i
    return -1
[/PYTHON]
[TESTS]
# Test case 1:
assert choose_num(1, 3) == 2
# Test case 2:
assert choose_num(1, 5) == 3
# Test case 3:
assert choose_num(4, 7) == 6
[/TESTS]
